title: Wireless System Validation Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for taking on big challenges? Do you love pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of our Wireless Hardware group, you’ll be responsible for bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world. On this team, you’ll help improve the performance of our products through innovative system-on-chip designs. You and your team will build platform architecture that paves the way for all-new experiences, including the ones that allow people to take advantage of our innovations in sensor technology. Together, our goal is to ensure nothing stands in the way of our customers’ connections with their devices. Join us and help build world-renowned wireless systems that connect customers to their world like never before.
description: You will be part of the dynamic and innovative Wireless/PHY System DVT team! The team is responsible for ensuring the Wireless/PHY system meets the design specification and functions correctly. The system design KPIsand functionalities include EVM, Sensitivity, Desense, RF/Baseband Performance, MIMO, Beamforming, and Coexistence. You will be responsible for developing and/or executing test methodologies for validating the Wireless/PHY system performance throughout the silicon development and deployment cycles. You will work with PHY/MAC/RF design engineers and system integration/test engineers.
key_qualifications:
Knowledge in wireless communication systems: WiFi and/or Cellular Technologies
Understanding of key performance indicators and impairments of RF and Baseband signals
Experience bringing up/testing wireless silicon in a lab
Experience developing and automating tests for the Wireless systems
Experience using and understanding lab equipment: signal analyzer, signal generator, spectrum analyzer
Experience with Python, Shell scripting, and/or C/C++/C#
education_experience: Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering + 3 years of relevant experience. Masters preferred.
